Rule: Having a higher education level (Masters) increases the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Being married or widowed may increase the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Being older (e.g., 74 years old) might be associated with higher earnings, possibly due to more experience or seniority.
Slightly varying the hours worked per week might improve the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Changing the workclass category might influence the income prediction.
